qas.question: In what year was the first permanent photograph produced?
Who invented the first permanent photograph?
What was Eugene Atget known for photographing?
Who was knows for photographing night scenes?
When did poster art become an important art form?

context: The inventor <a1_0>Nicéphore Niépce<a1_0/> produced the first permanent photograph on a polished pewter plate in Paris in <a0_0>1825<a0_0/>, and then developed the process with Louis Daguerre. The work of Étienne-Jules Marey in the 1880s contributed considerably to the development of modern photography. Photography came to occupy a central role in Parisian Surrealist activity, in the works of Man Ray and Maurice Tabard. Numerous photographers achieved renown for their photography of Paris, including Eugène Atget, noted for his depictions of <a2_0>street scenes<a2_0/>, Robert Doisneau, noted for his playful pictures of people and market scenes (among which Le baiser de l'hôtel de ville has became iconic of the romantic vision of Paris), <a3_0>Marcel Bovis<a3_0/>, noted for his night scenes, and others such as Jacques-Henri Lartigue and Cartier-Bresson. Poster art also became an important art form in Paris in the <a4_0>late nineteenth century<a4_0/>, through the work of Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec, Jules Chéret, Eugène Grasset, Adolphe Willette, Pierre Bonnard, Georges de Feure, Henri-Gabriel Ibels, Gavarni, and Alphonse Mucha.
